content: this legal case involves a coownership property that has been ongoing for 2 years and 8 months the final resolution is that the property will be dissolved and sold at a public auction the property includes a twobedroom apartment kitchen bathroom and common areas the case involves two parties referred to as the plaintiff and the defendant who each own a ½ share of the property the property is registered in the land registry and is located in a specific municipality the court used the principles of the property act to make its decision the defendant contested the plaintiffs claim to coownership and the coownership ratios were disputed an expert examination determined that the properties could not be divided geometrically and their market values were assessed the plaintiff then initiated a lawsuit to dissolve the coownership and sell the properties with the proceeds being distributed proportionally the defendant responded by claiming frivolous litigation and making accusations against the plaintiff the court reviewed various documents and confirmed the coownership and inheritance details due to the expert opinion and the inability to divide the properties the court decided to dissolve the coownership and sell the properties through a public bidding process both parties have the right to participate in the bidding and purchase the properties with the highest bid
